alert.note: Alert for Northern Jackson; Southern Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:50PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Jackson County through 630 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hickory Hills, or 7 miles northeast of Ocean Springs, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocean Springs, Moss Point, Escatawpa, Gautier, Latimer, Gulf Hills, Vancleave, Gulf Park Estates, Hickory Hills and Helena. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 50 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
